summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from February 23, 2021, covering a wide range of national security, law enforcement, and political news. It includes significant coverage of Merrick Garland's confirmation hearing for Attorney General, where he commented on the Jeffrey Epstein case, the Capitol riot investigation, and other DOJ matters. The briefing also reports on various criminal investigations, cyber threats, and domestic terrorism issues.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Subject of Senate Judiciary Committee confirmation hearing; vowed to investigate Capitol riot, called Epstein case treatment 'horrendous', and discussed independence of DOJ.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in context of Garland calling his case treatment 'horrendous'; reference to his 2019 indictment and 2008 non-prosecution deal.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Former U.S. Attorney who resolved Epstein's 2008 sex-crimes case through a non-prosecution deal; DOJ investigation found he showed 'poor judgment'.

persons.name: John Durham
persons.context: Leading investigation into origins of Trump-Russia probe; Garland said he saw 'no reason' why Durham should not remain in place.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Garland refused to comment on whether Comey was a good FBI director during his confirmation hearing.

persons.name: Andrew Cuomo
persons.context: Mentioned in context of Garland vowing DOJ probe of New York nursing homes will be free of conflicts; Cuomo's administration is under investigation.

persons.name: Melissa DeRosa
persons.role: Secretary to the Governor of New York
persons.context: Member of Cuomo's coronavirus task force; her mother-in-law is SDNY US Attorney Audrey Strauss, creating potential conflict in nursing home probe.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Mother-in-law of Melissa DeRosa; Garland committed to avoiding conflict of interest in Cuomo nursing home investigation.

persons.name: Larry Nassar
persons.context: Subject of sexual abuse scandal; Garland supports release of report on FBI's handling of Nassar probe.

persons.name: Jessica Watkins
persons.context: Charged with participating in Jan. 6 Capitol riot; initially claimed meeting with Secret Service, then altered story.

persons.name: Henry 'Enrique' Tarrio
persons.context: Charged with burning Black Lives Matter banner in DC; ruled compliant with pretrial services.

persons.name: Suzanne Kaye
persons.context: Arrested for threatening to kill FBI agents after they contacted her about Jan. 6 visit to DC.

persons.name: Nicholes Lentz
persons.context: Former Florida police officer charged with taking part in Jan. 6 Capitol insurrection.

persons.name: Ryan Ashlock
persons.context: Linked to Kansas City metro chapter of Proud Boys; arrested for conspiring in Capitol riot.

persons.name: Harry Dunn
persons.context: First Capitol Police officer to speak publicly about Jan. 6 attack; described racial slurs and violence.

persons.name: Brian O'Hare
persons.context: Authored op-ed supporting making domestic terrorism a federal crime.

persons.name: Ahmed Mohammed al-Shamrani
persons.context: Perpetrator of 2019 Pensacola Navy Base mass shooting; families of victims suing Saudi Arabia.

persons.name: Kevin Clinesmith
persons.context: Prosecuted by John Durham; may be only criminal charge from Durham's investigation.

persons.name: Emma Coronel Aispuro
persons.context: Arrested on drug charges for helping Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman run cartel and plot prison escape.

persons.name: Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman
persons.context: Husband of Emma Coronel Aispuro; former head of Sinaloa drug cartel.

persons.name: Elijah McClain
persons.context: 23-year-old Black man who died after police encounter in Aurora, Colorado; investigation faulted police treatment.

persons.name: Savannah Grace Childress
persons.context: 14-year-old girl kidnapped from North Carolina, rescued after shootout in Arkansas.

persons.name: William Robert Ice
persons.context: Kidnapped Savannah Childress; shot and killed himself after police chase.

persons.name: Eric Spencer
persons.context: Arrested in connection with Manhattan Chanel store robbery; arrested by FBI-NYPD task force.

persons.name: Malcolm X
persons.context: Family released letter alleging FBI and NYPD involvement in his 1965 assassination.

persons.name: Raymond A. Wood
persons.context: Wrote letter alleging NYPD and FBI conspired in Malcolm X assassination by entrapping security team.

persons.name: Ben Crump
persons.context: Represented Malcolm X's family in press conference about new assassination evidence.

persons.name: William Sweeney
persons.context: Commented on FBI cooperation with Manhattan DA's office on Malcolm X case review.

persons.name: Askia Muhammad Aquil
persons.context: Florida man who claims FBI targeted him in 1971 for civil rights activities; acquitted multiple times.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned throughout briefing in various contexts including COVID response, nominations, and policy initiatives.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in context of Supreme Court tax return case, election challenges, and comparisons to Biden administration.

persons.name: Neera Tanden
persons.context: Facing Senate opposition for OMB nomination due to past Twitter attacks on Republicans.

persons.name: Deb Haaland
persons.context: First Native American nominated to cabinet; facing Republican opposition over oil/gas drilling views.

persons.name: Xavier Becerra
persons.context: Facing conservative opposition for HHS nomination; targeted in ad campaigns.

connections.description: Garland commented on Epstein case during confirmation hearing, calling treatment 'horrendous'.
Acosta was U.S. Attorney who resolved Epstein's 2008 case through non-prosecution deal.
Garland said he saw 'no reason' why Durham should not remain as Special Counsel investigating Trump-Russia probe origins.
DeRosa is Secretary to Governor Cuomo and member of his coronavirus task force.
Strauss is DeRosa's mother-in-law, creating potential conflict in Cuomo nursing home investigation.
Coronel is wife of El Chapo; accused of helping him run cartel and plot prison escape.
Wood alleged in letter that NYPD and FBI conspired in Malcolm X assassination by entrapping his security team.
Crump represented Malcolm X's family in press conference about new assassination evidence.

events.title: Garland Confirmation Hearing
events.description: Merrick Garland's Senate Judiciary Committee confirmation hearing for Attorney General; he vowed to investigate Capitol riot, called Epstein case 'horrendous', and discussed DOJ independence.

events.title: Capitol Riot
events.description: Attack on U.S. Capitol by pro-Trump supporters; FBI identified over 500 suspects and made over 200 arrests.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein indicted for sexually exploiting and abusing dozens of minor girls at his homes in New York and Florida.

events.title: Pensacola Navy Base Shooting
events.description: Mass shooting at Naval Air Station Pensacola by Royal Saudi Air Force officer Ahmed al-Shamrani.

events.title: Elijah McClain Death
events.description: Elijah McClain died after police encounter in Aurora, Colorado; investigation released faulting police treatment.

events.title: Malcolm X Assassination
events.description: Malcolm X assassinated at Audubon Ballroom in New York; family released new evidence alleging FBI/NYPD involvement.

events.title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump Tax Appeal
events.description: Supreme Court rejected Trump's final bid to block release of tax returns to Manhattan DA.

locations: Audubon Ballroom, New York (Malcolm X assassination)
Dulles International Airport, Virginia (Emma Coronel arrest)
keyFacts: Attorney General-designate Merrick Garland called the treatment of Jeffrey Epstein's case 'horrendous' during his confirmation hearing.
The FBI had identified over 500 suspects and made more than 200 arrests in the Capitol siege investigation as of February 2021.
Garland said he saw 'no reason' why Special Counsel John Durham should not remain in place to continue his Trump-Russia probe investigation.
The family of Malcolm X released a letter from former NYPD officer Raymond Wood alleging FBI and NYPD involvement in his 1965 assassination.
Emma Coronel Aispuro, wife of Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman, was arrested on drug charges for helping run the Sinaloa cartel and plot his prison escape.
